text: is a Japanese politician. Before, she was a singer, actress, and racing driver. She is a member of the Liberal Democratic Party. She has been a Member of the House of Councillors since 2010. Mihara made her debut as a teenager in the 1979 television series Kinpachi-sensei, and began a singing career in 1980. Her first hit sold more than 300,000 copies. Mihara is a cervical cancer survivor. In October 2024, she joined the political cabinet of Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba. ==References== Category:1964 births Category:Living people Category:Liberal Democratic Party (Japan) politicians Category:Singers from Tokyo Category:Actors from Tokyo Category:Politicians from Tokyo Category:Japanese racecar drivers Category:Sportspeople from Tokyo Category:Japanese movie actors Category:Japanese television actors
title: Junko Mihara
